content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here's a function called `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks from a given markdown document `md`, removes code fences, and joins the code blocks together with a newline. This function is written in Julia.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::AbstractString)
    lines = split(md, r"\n\r?\n")
    code_blocks = []

    pushfirst!(code_blocks, [])
    current_block = first(code_blocks)

    for line in lines
        if startswith(line, "```") && endswith(line, "```")
            if !isempty(current_block)
                push!(code_blocks, [])
                current_block = last(code_blocks)
            end
        elseif !isempty(current_block)
            push!(current_block, line)
        end
    end

    joined_code_blocks = []
    for code_block in code_blocks
        if !isempty(code_block)
            push!(joined_code_blocks, join(code_block, "\n"))
        end
    end

    return join(joined_code_blocks, "\n\n")
end
```

This function processes a string `md` that represents the markdown document. It extracts all the code blocks and joins them together with newlines before returning a single string containing all the code blocks.
